intro: Ononis cheiranthoides, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically produces white or pinkish flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in sandy or rocky soils. Ononis cheiranthoides is native to regions of Europe and is often found in open, dry habitats.
